faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Answers to the most common questions from our patients
faq.noResults: We couldn't find any questions for your search.
faq.notFoundDescription: Fill out the contact form and we'll help you with any question

1.question: How often should I come for a check-up?
1.answer: We recommend a check-up every 6 months. This helps early detection of problems, when treatment is simpler and cheaper.

2.question: From what age can I bring my child?
2.answer: We recommend the first visit at 2-3 years old or when all baby teeth appear. We make the visit fun for the little ones!

3.question: How long does healing take after extraction?
3.answer: Initial healing takes 1-2 weeks. Complete bone healing takes 3-6 months.

1.question: Are treatments painful?
1.answer: We use the most modern anesthesia methods. Most patients don't feel pain during treatment. Your comfort is our priority.

2.question: Does teeth whitening damage enamel?
2.answer: No, professional whitening done correctly is safe. We use certified products that protect enamel.

3.question: How long does a dental implant take?
3.answer: The complete process takes 3-6 months. The first stage (implant placement) takes about 1 hour.

1.question: How much does a consultation cost?
1.answer: The first consultation for new patients is FREE. Includes complete examination and treatment plan.

2.question: Do you accept CNAM insurance?
2.answer: Yes, we accept CNAM insurance for covered services. Our team will help you with the necessary documents.

3.question: Can I pay in installments?
3.answer: Yes! We offer interest-free installments for treatments over 3,000 MDL. Approval is on the spot.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.description: Information about how we collect and protect your personal data
privacy.intro: Tandem Dent SRL ("we", "our" or "the Clinic") respects the confidentiality of your personal data. This policy describes how we collect, use, and protect your information.

dataCollected.title: 1. Data We Collect
dataCollected.content: We collect the following types of personal data:
items: Contact information: name, phone number, email address
Appointment information: requested service, additional messages
Technical data: basic device information for website functionality (via Vercel Analytics)

dataUsage.title: 2. How We Use Your Data
items: Communicate with you about our services
Send newsletters (only if you have subscribed)

dataStorage.title: 3. Data Storage
dataStorage.content: Your data is stored securely on protected servers. We use trusted services like Neon (PostgreSQL database) and Vercel for hosting. All data is encrypted in transit and at rest.

dataSharing.title: 4. Data Sharing
dataSharing.content: We do not sell, rent, or share your personal data with third parties, except when necessary to provide our services or when required by law.

rights.title: 5. Your Rights
items: Access the personal data we hold about you
Unsubscribe from the newsletter at any time

gdpr.title: GDPR Compliance
gdpr.description: Information about your rights under the General Data Protection Regulation
gdpr.intro: Tandem Dent SRL is committed to protecting your personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and local data protection legislation.

legalBasis.title: 2. Legal Basis for Processing
legalBasis.content: We process your data based on the following legal grounds:
items: Legitimate interest: for improving our services

rights.title: 3. Your GDPR Rights
rights.content: Under GDPR, you have the following rights:
items: Right of access - you can request a copy of your data
Right to rectification - you can request correction of inaccurate data
Right to erasure - you can request deletion of data ("right to be forgotten")
Right not to be subject to automated decision-making

retention.title: 4. Data Retention Period
retention.content: We keep your data only as long as necessary for the purposes for which it was collected:
items: Appointment data: 5 years (according to medical regulations)

security.title: 5. Data Security
security.content: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your data, including encryption, restricted access, and regular security audits.

complaint.title: 6. Right to Lodge a Complaint
complaint.content: If you believe your rights have been violated, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the data protection supervisory authority in the Republic of Moldova (National Center for Personal Data Protection).

contact.content: For any GDPR-related requests, please contact us:
